lead_paragraph: SILVERMAN--Ruben D.,age 88, died on January 14, 2016, of complications of Parkinson's Disease. A lifelong resident of Lakewood, NJ, Mr. Silverman practiced law in Lakewood for over 55 years, representing a broad and diverse swath of the Lakewood community including Congregation Sons of Israel (the first Orthodox synagogue in Lakewood), and the operators of the Point Pleasant Beach. Mr. Silverman was a graduate from Lakewood High School in 1944, and then enlisted in the United States Navy at age 17, serving on the USS Nassau during the closing days of World War II. Upon the conclusion of his military service, he returned to New Jersey where he attended and was a graduate from Seton Hall College. He then entered the first class of Seton Hall Law School, and, after obtaining his J.D., began a law practice with his late brother, Orion Silverman. He practiced law for 55 years before retiring. He held positions on the local election, tax and zoning boards. He is survived by his wife of 60 years, Phyllis, and three children: Sharon Lieberman (and her husband, Steven), Dr. Lawrence Silverman (and his wife, Jodi Moise) and Barbara Hirsch (and her husband, Dr. Mark Hirsch), as well as seven grandchildren: Rachel Lieberman, Jessica Lieberman, Benjamin Lieberman, Joshua Moise-Silverman, Samuel Moise-Silverman, Corey Hirsch and Sarah Hirsch. Funeral services will be at the Mt. Sinai Cemetery in Lakewood, NJ, on Friday, January 15, 2016, 9:00am. The family asks that donations in his memory be made to the Lakewood Historical Society or to the Overlook Foundation, Attention: Movement Disorder Fund, in memory of Ruben Silverman. Services entrusted to Torchinsky Hebrew Funeral Home, Washington, DC, 202-541-1001. 1/3
